did.abstract: Russell M. Magnaghi is professor of history at Northern Michigan University. The collection consists of oral history recordings and transcripts and photographs, developed as part of Magnaghi's work in documenting history and ethnicity of the Upper Peninsula and Michigan in general.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Russell M. Magnaghi (donor no. 6911) in several accessions.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Russell M. Magnaghi collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Russell M. Magnaghi is professor of history at Northern Michigan University.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of three series developed as part of Magnaghi's work in documenting history and ethnicity of the Upper Peninsula and Michigan in general. The series are Italian-American Immigrant Oral History Series; Ethnic Heritage of Presque Isle County, Mich.; and Photographs.

During the period between 1982 and 1985 Magnaghi interviewed over 150 individuals with a variety of backgrounds as part of a project of the Center for Oral History at Northern Michigan University dealing with Italian immigration into Upper Michigan, also known as the Upper Peninsula. These interviews offer insight into the immigrant experience. The project visited every Italian-American community in Upper Michigan, neighboring Wisconsin, and Ontario. These communities included:

Magnaghi donated the original tapes to the Northern Michigan University Archives. Two additional copies are available at the Bentley Historical Library and at the Immigration History Research Center at the University of Minnesota.

Magnaghi published a book entitled Miners, Merchants, and Midwives: Michigan's Upper Peninsula Italians (1987) based on the interviews on tape in this collection and on summaries of interviews not on tape.
The collection as held by the Bentley Library includes cassette taped interviews, a catalog of the interviews, and indexes to many of the interviews.

scopecontent.p: The series contains eighteen interviews conducted in 2008 with residents of Presque Isle County, Mich., particularly relating to local history and ethnicity. The collection includes cassette tapes, transcripts, compact disc copies of the tapes, and Microsoft Word files (doc and docx) for the transcripts.
Magnaghi's book Ethnic Heritage of Presque Isle County (2010), is based on this oral history project.

did.unittitle: Goetz, Dorothy; Painter, Dorothy; Mullins, Betsy
Microsoft Word files (doc and docx) for transcripts

scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs (copy prints, some with captions) collected in Magnaghi's research for books in the series Discovering the Peoples of Michigan.
